message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The woman’s serum test results show that she has acute hepatitis A, and her child’s immunizations are up-to-date. Hepatitis A is typically spread through contaminated food and water, and it is unlikely that the child has been exposed to the virus through his mother’s sickness. Therefore, no additional steps are needed for the child at this time.
